Eli.Action: Shoots a cat with an arrow to defend himself or survive.
Recoils in surprise and is stunned when attacked by the wounded cat.
Conceals himself expertly with a ghillie suit, remains hidden and patient, successfully shoots a cat with an arrow.
Recoils and falls backward after the mortally wounded cat fights back aggressively.
Struggles violently with a wounded cat, holding it down and clubbing it until it stops moving.
Bundles up the dead cat and leaves it respectfully rather than discarding it carelessly.
Examines a mummified body dispassionately, showing a lack of explicit emotional reaction.
Successfully wrestles and subdues a mortally wounded but aggressive cat using a fallen branch, demonstrating physical skill and composure under threat.
Efficiently packs up his ghillie suit and possessions including a shotgun and a samurai sword, showing preparedness and practical organization.
Cautiously surveys a deserted road and approaches an abandoned car, checking its condition and examining a corpse dispassionately, indicating situational awareness and emotional control.
Attempts to open a jammed car door by exerting increasing force until successful, showing persistence and practical problem-solving.
Curses under his breath upon noticing the deceased has no shoes or socks, indicating frustration but no sign of poor judgment or error.
Stops at a fork in the road and deliberately chooses the path away from the ruined city, possibly avoiding danger or chaos.
Walks through abandoned town steadily, ignoring petrified corpses lying in the street.
Does not loot abandoned stores, knowing they are empty and choosing not to disturb the remnants.
Changes direction at a fork in the road after a brief pause, choosing the path away from the ruined city.
Navigates through wasteland and an abandoned town, side-stepping rubble and corpses without hesitation.
Does not check empty, looted stores, recognizing they have nothing to offer.
Strokes the lady's high-heeled shoe leather thoughtfully before shaking his head grimly and tossing it back.
Drags his sheathed sword idly along empty racks while checking for supplies.
Kicks open the front door with shotgun ready, enters cautiously.
Carefully checks the emptied shoe store, verifies thoroughly before leaving.
Notices an overlooked shoe box, inspects it to confirm contents.
Assesses the shoe and decides it is not useful, discards it with a grim shake of the head.
Chooses an abandoned but habitable house to take shelter, showing foresight and planning.
Enters the house prepared and alert, holding a shotgun ready for threats.
Methodically searches the kitchen, including cupboards and freezer, for supplies.
Shows disgust but quickly covers the freezer after finding a human hand, avoiding lingering on the horror and focusing on survival.
Calmly handles the corpse and respectfully uses the man's shoes, showing practicality without disrespect or revulsion.
Sits quietly to pray, expressing gratitude and humility for his provisions and guidance.
Calmly examines and replaces his ruined boots with suitable sneakers found on a hanging corpse, showing resourcefulness and calm under disturbing circumstances.
Practices caution and cleanliness by shaking off debris from the shoes before using them.
Tests the new shoes by pacing to ensure a proper fit before continuing.
Roasts a cat carcass carefully over a small campfire, checking doneness and preparing food for sustenance.
Prays quietly for strength and guidance, demonstrating mental focus and emotional resilience.
Offers a piece of meat to a rat emerging from his coat pocket.
Gazes lovingly at an old leather-bound book and touches it gently.
Listens to music alone using an iPod, enjoying it deeply but keeping to himself.
Carefully unwraps and handles an old leather-bound book, showing respect and care for a cherished object.
Shows ability to rig a car battery and electrical wiring to power a beat-up iPod successfully.
Interacts skillfully and confidently with his environment, including feeding a rat and savoring food.
Puts on headphones and fully immerses himself in music, showing thoughtful and deliberate behavior.
Allows a rat to climb on him and even hide in his pocket without reacting negatively.
Breathes in the warm morning sun, showing appreciation for simple warmth in nature.
Approaches a terrified, starving young woman who cowers and offers him food out of fear.
Checks the battery of his headphones after waking and notices it's dead; methodically prepares his backpack and weapons before leaving.
Pauses to observe the environment and the young woman in need before engaging.
Does not immediately respond to the young woman's offer and stands silently, making his expression unreadable.
Says 'I'm not going to hurt you.' and offers the young woman some of the spilled contents on the cart.
Bends down to help despite potential danger, though he remains cautious and alert to the threat nearby.
Detects the presence of bandits and chooses to back away from the young woman to avoid falling into a trap.
Detects ambush by sniffing the air and noticing the bandits before they attack.
Bends down to offer food cautiously, showing restraint and care despite the potential threat.
Backs away from the girl upon confirming the ambush, avoiding a direct confrontation at a tactical disadvantage.
Does not try to immediately fight or overpower the bandits despite being surrounded.
Remains calm and speaks softly when threatened by bandits, tries to de-escalate with warnings about protection from his boss.
Refuses to comply with bandits' demand to open his pack despite threat to harm him.
Uses authoritative and ominous language about vengeance through himself, indicating a willingness to resort to violence to protect what he values.

Remains perfectly calm and composed when threatened by armed bandits, speaks with a soft but formidable tone asserting protection from a powerful figure, refuses to comply with demands despite danger.
Refuses to reveal the contents of the pack or disarm himself in a high-risk situation, possibly avoiding impulsive or reckless behavior.
Does not attempt to flee or use force immediately despite being surrounded and threatened, showing strategic restraint.
Warns bandit leader not to touch him again in a firm but calm manner.
Severs the bandit leader's hand swiftly when attacked.
Kills the four attacking bandits decisively.
Kicks the severed hand away so the bandit cannot retrieve it, then kills the bandit leader.
Walks past the sobbing young woman without harming her, gathers her supplies and returns them to her, warning her not to associate with men like the bandits.
Does not answer the young woman's question about why he is helping her.
After killing the bandits, arranges their bodies respectfully and prays for them.
Absolves the young woman from her sins with a sincere prayer.
Responds to the young woman's gratitude by saying 'There are no good men on the road.'
Denies the young woman’s request to accompany him without turning back or explanation.
Hesitates to intervene during the assault and murder of the couple, repeating 'It ain't your concern' to himself and others nearby; ultimately does not act to stop the attackers.
After the bikers leave, Eli emerges, kneels before the dead couple, signs a cross over their bodies, and mutters a prayer under his breath.
Hesitates to intervene when the woman is being attacked despite wanting to help, chooses to stay hidden and not confront the bikers.
Waits patiently and carefully until the threat has passed before emerging from hiding.
Reluctant to enter the town but braces himself and walks in to engage with others.
Slowly raises hands and calmly attempts to de-escalate a tense situation with the engineer pointing a shotgun at him.
Explains he is just a customer and apologizes for carrying a gun into town, showing respect for local norms.
Does not attempt any sudden moves or aggression despite being threatened with a shotgun.
Calmly de-escalates a tense situation with a suspicious armed man by complying with demands and talking in a non-threatening manner.
Forgets local customs about carrying weapons in town, which raises suspicion from the engineer.
Keeps composure under threat, slowly sets down his weapon and obeys commands to avoid conflict.
Steadily shows his hand to the engineer, calming his nervousness.
Politely explains he needs help and offers to pay.
Smiles when asked if he trusts the engineer, admitting he doesn't know him.
Keeps his hand steady under threat, calmly negotiates with the engineer, confidently produces a valuable item (car battery) to trade, and patiently waits while the battery is charged.
Asks about water, showing practical concern for needs.
Threatens the engineer violently and shows a lack of trust.
Negotiates for water information and assesses situation carefully before leaving.
Intimidates the engineer with a clear, confident threat, demonstrating control and decisive communication.
Shoos the cat off the bar with a wave of his hand after it hissed at him.
Negotiates a bartering deal confidently by offering pelts instead of selling valuable pendant, showing awareness of value and priorities.
Maintains calm and steady demeanor under suspicion from bartender and bikers, signaling emotional control.
Shoos the suspicious cat off the bar with a simple gesture, demonstrating quick situational handling.
Does not look back at Solara after she takes his canteen, remaining inscrutable and unreadable.
Allows the bartender to give Solara his canteen and ration card without objection.
Remains calm and unreadable when confronted by Hog, showing controlled demeanor and confidence.
Does not engage with Solara or acknowledge her looking him over, which might suggest some social detachment but no clear incompetence.
Says sorry after Hog accuses him of pushing him and promises it won't happen again.
Attempts to de-escalate tension by telling Hog to go back to his table and that he will be on his way.
Pins Hog’s head with his thumb and uses intimidation to convey judgment about Hog's crimes, invoking punishment and warning.
Shows visible anger after being pushed multiple times and sighs with frustration.
Pins Hog's head with his thumb to a nerve cluster, paralyzing him instantly and de-escalating the immediate threat.
Calmly asserts knowledge about Hog's past crimes and warns him of consequences, demonstrating confidence and situational awareness.
Attempts to avoid conflict by telling Hog he doesn't want trouble, showing prudence and emotional control.
Reacting with visible anger after being blocked by patrons, showing a crack in his usual calm demeanor.
Carves a line in the dirt with his sword after quoting scripture, presenting himself calmly and purposefully despite hostile attention.
Cuts a one-man swath of mayhem through a dozen brawlers, killing most and effortlessly felling the last two men attacking him.
Lowers sword and spares Hog's life when Solara pleads for mercy, showing restraint and not judging Hog.
Gently takes canteen from Solara with a thank you, acknowledging her kindness.
Kills Hog when attacked from behind, demonstrating necessary violence for self-defense.
Apologizes to Solara for the violent aftermath, showing some remorse and consideration.
Circles Hog like a predator, holding sword ready and skillfully dealing with threats.
Freezes and pauses when Solara cries out, then lowers sword and spares Hog, showing thoughtful restraint.
Quickly reacts to Hog’s surprise attack from behind by flipping sword to skewer Hog effectively.
Apologizes for the bloodied scene, showing empathy and awareness beyond mere combat.
Remains calm and silent under the threat of multiple guns trained on him, showing composure in a dangerous situation.
Answers Carnegie’s questions clearly and without hesitation, demonstrating thoughtful and purposeful communication.
Does not over-explain or become defensive despite being scrutinized and intimidated.
Does not react emotionally or impulsively to Carnegie's provocations or judgments.
States he didn't come looking for trouble when entering town.
Questions Carnegie about the use of slave labor for building the monument.
Tells Carnegie it's none of his business what he does in his town and that he just wants to be on his way.
Refuses to give his name in response to Carnegie's question.
Disengages from Carnegie's manipulative rhetoric, remains unmoved and does not get drawn into argument.
Refuses to reveal his name to Carnegie, maintaining his anonymity and control of information.
Responds minimally and directly, indicating focus on his goal and avoiding unnecessary conflict.
Fails to challenge or expose Carnegie's lies or manipulation beyond a brief rebuke, potentially missing opportunity to undermine Carnegie.
Responds politely to Carnegie's questions, shows restraint despite Carnegie's pushiness.
Refuses Carnegie's offer to work for him, clearly states boundaries.
Does not engage in Carnegie's attempts to charm or manipulate him.
Deflects questions about who told him there is something west, maintaining privacy.
Politely refuses a helpful offer and requests to leave without conflict, warning he could fight if necessary.
Leans in and confronts the engineer about a possible lie regarding the battery's readiness, showing distrust.
Questions Carnegie about sending someone to the engineer, showing caution and suspicion.
Even though guarded and suspicious, he responds politely with 'Hello?' when door is knocked and Claudia enters.
Does not react with hostility or rudeness despite being distrusted and watched constantly by Redridge.
Questions Carnegie's honesty by asking if he sent someone to the engineer, demonstrating awareness and skepticism.
Paces the room and reflects internally about his situation after being confined to the guest bedroom, showing thoughtful consideration.
Lies down on the bed and rests after being trapped, which could indicate conserving energy or resignation.
Takes the food and water offered by Claudia with a polite 'Thank you.'
Engages Claudia in conversation, expressing a desire for genuine interaction.
Raises a hand reassuringly when Claudia struggles with painful memories.
Asks about Claudia being 'Carnegie's woman' but clarifies it is just conversation.
Accepts help graciously despite unfamiliarity with polite social interaction.
Initiates conversation to break social isolation and build rapport.
Shows empathy and emotional intelligence by reassuring Claudia when she struggles with a difficult memory.
Pulls out a chair and offers it to Claudia, inviting her to eat.
Engages Claudia in gentle conversation, showing interest in her life and condition.
Stands and escorts Claudia to the door, opening it for her.
Politely offers a chair and engages Claudia in conversation, showing social awareness and confidence.
Stands and escorts Claudia to the door, demonstrating courteous and controlled behavior.
Strokes Claudia's hair tenderly as she cries.
Jumps up and hurriedly hides the book when someone knocks at the door.
Politely allows Solara to come in despite being disarmed by her presence.
Refuses additional food and water, indicating self-sufficiency but not refusing aid harshly.
Tries to explain he doesn't mean to be rude when interacting with Solara.
Jumps up and hurriedly hides the book inside his shirt when there's a knock at the door.
Quickly establishes a boundary by clearly stating he already has food and water and does not need more.
Maintains composure and responds calmly to Solara's seductive behavior without being verbally compromised.
Is disarmed by Solara's seduction and lets her change the lighting without objection.
Gently rejects Solara's sexual advance, expressing respect for her and himself.
Opens the door for Solara to leave after rejecting her.
Expresses concern for Solara and her mother upon learning they're in danger.
Moves to confront the abuser to protect Solara and her mother.
Does not force Solara to stay despite her plea, showing restraint.
Reassures Solara that she doesn't have to be afraid of him and initiates a gentle conversation.
Smiles back at Solara sincerely when she compliments him.
Listens patiently and thoughtfully to Solara's questions about the past.
Engages thoughtfully and calmly in conversation with Solara, showing emotional intelligence and self-control.
Admits uncertainty about his exact age but remains composed and confident in his response.
Is surprised by Solara's reading of character but responds positively, showing social perceptiveness.
Offers to share a meaningful reading from his Bible with Solara, despite the danger of showing possession of a book.
Reads a comforting and hopeful passage aloud to Solara, showing patience and intent to provide emotional reassurance.
Smiles modestly when asked about the reading, showing sincerity and humility.
Hesitates before sharing his knowledge, indicating cautiousness but ultimately chooses openness.
Demonstrates literacy by reading aloud confidently from the King James Bible to Solara, showing familiarity and comfort with the text.
Pauses and thinks carefully before deciding to reveal his ability to read and the possession of a book, indicating prudent judgment.
Snatches the book away from Solara to protect it, stating he is charged to protect it and cannot trust it with anyone.
Clearly explains why the book is special and the unique circumstances of its survival, demonstrating knowledge and awareness.
Admits uncertainty about where he is going and what he should do initially, reflecting a moment of confusion and lack of clear direction.
Describes hearing an inner voice that guides him to the book, relying on intuition or faith rather than explicit logic or evidence.
Smiles when talking about the powerful voice, showing a gentle demeanor.
Declines Solara's request to teach her to read, citing his imminent departure.
Notices Solara's sadness and tries to shift focus by asking if she is hungry and inviting her to eat.
Has been following a voice for twenty-five years with faith, showing persistence and self-trust in his mission.
Is open and confident when explaining his knowledge and mission despite skepticism from others.
Refuses to stay or teach Solara to read despite her request, showing a focused and decisive mindset, but possibly lacking flexibility or mentorship.
Calmly reassures Solara about the rat, demonstrating control and gentle leadership.
Shares food thoughtfully and prays before eating, showing presence of mind and maintaining rituals for morale.
Admits friendship honestly, showing emotional intelligence and self-awareness.
Prays and gives thanks for friendship during hard times, sharing a meal with Solara.
Teaches Solara to say a prayer and expresses gratitude and caring through it.
Teaches Solara to pray and express gratitude using words from a book despite harsh circumstances.
Allows Solara to develop spiritual strength and literacy, indicating skillful mentorship.
Is referenced by Solara confidently as the source of her knowledge and behavior, showing leadership and influence.
Returns fire and wounds an attacker who threatens him; moves quickly to escape pursuing gunmen.
Emerges calmly holding a shotgun despite being outnumbered; returns fire quickly and wounds an opponent.
Fires shotgun accurately without looking and hits a pursuer squarely.
Dives for cover and takes a moment to reload amidst active pursuit and gunfire.
Signs a cross and offers a silent prayer before engaging in violence.
Initially decides to stay on path and not intervene as Carnegie mistreats Solara.
Hears girl’s scream and changes mind, marches back to confront Carnegie and protect Solara.
Knocks out Redridge without hesitation to prevent further harm.
Levels shotgun at Carnegie to get him to release Solara.
Emerges from cover under heavy fire and kills three gunmen with precise and rapid shotgun fire.
Considers ignoring the distant scream and staying on his path but ultimately decides to intervene despite potential risk, showing thoughtful decision-making.
Cold-cocks a wounded opponent without hesitation while maintaining focus and movement, demonstrating tactical awareness and decisiveness.
Kicks open the door and confronts the threatening antagonist quickly and assertively, showing confidence and control of the situation.
Levels shotgun at Carnegie's head to protect Solara and orders him to let her go.
Says 'I reckon you're right' acknowledging Carnegie's statement about risking harm to Solara.
Holsters shotgun and instead threatens Carnegie with a precise, less lethal pistol shot to protect Solara.
Refuses to show the Bible to Carnegie despite his sincere plea.
Smoothly switches weapons from shotgun to hidden pistol, demonstrating preparedness and tactical skill.
Calmly negotiates by threatening precise pistol fire instead of risking collateral damage with shotgun.
Refuses to show the bible despite Carnegie's pleas and offers, maintaining control over valuable knowledge.
Offers Solara his hand and leads her out of theater and town, showing a protective and guiding behavior.
Stops to destroy the statue of Carnegie, a defiant but symbolic act that might unsettle others.
Tells Solara she is free to go wherever she wants instead of forcing her, showing a form of respect for her freedom.
Says to Solara 'You're only going to slow me down' and continues walking without stopping, forcing her to catch up, which can be seen as dismissive or cold.
Stops a man from hurting Solara, freeing her from danger.
Tells Solara she is free to do whatever she wants without expectation of gratitude.
Refuses to let Solara travel with him despite her plea, citing his dangerous journey and desire to protect her.
Tells Solara harsh truths about the dangers of his life and insists she not follow him because he believes she deserves more and shouldn't be alone like him.
Leaves Solara alone on the road after refusing to let her come with him, ignoring her emotional plea and anger.
Stops a man who was hurting Solara, effectively protecting her.
Joins a difficult journey alone to focus on his mission, showing clarity and decisiveness.
Attempts to dissuade Solara from coming with him to protect her from danger, thinking ahead about risks.
Unable to effectively communicate his reasons to Solara, leading to conflict and hurt feelings.
Chooses isolation and prioritizes mission over companionship despite Solara’s offer, indicating strong resolve.
Walks away from Solara without responding or engaging, remaining silent and confident in his decision.
Takes down four men and escapes unharmed despite being shot at a hundred times.
Walks steadily and confidently down a desolate road, maintaining focus on the horizon.
Suddenly stops and stands stock still in the center of the road, making his thoughts unreadable.
No direct action or presence in the scene; does not intervene or respond to the female voice calling for help nor the impending threat.
Shoots a precise and sudden arrow to incapacitate the brigand leader before he can assault Solara.
Shoots an arrow to disable the rifle without killing the bandit instantly.
Kills the knife-wielding brigand in a quick, efficient manner.
Offers the two wounded bandits a final chance to seek forgiveness and salvation.
Offers the dying men a chance to seek forgiveness for their sins.
Kills the brigand leader without pity after being spat on.
Pauses before killing the second bandit when he asks for forgiveness and helps him recite a prayer.
Signs a cross over the dead bandit's body as a gesture of respect.
Cares for Solara by gathering her in his arms and acknowledging friendship.
Tells Solara to keep up and pull her weight after helping her, showing practical toughness.
Tells Solara that if she falls behind, he can't help her, emphasizing self-reliance.
Dismisses the young slumped woman by saying there's nothing that can be done for her and walks on.
Uses camouflage effectively to approach prey, shows skill in hunting and survival.
Demonstrates practical knowledge by explaining necessity of eating available food.
Successfully cooks the prairie dog to safe, edible status, indicating competence in food preparation.
Shows presence of mind and calm confidence in teasing Solara, engaging with social ease though in a survival situation.
Offers a prayer before eating, showing mindfulness but not directly related to competence in practical skills.
Smiles as Solara eats, engages her with a warm, meaningful story about Saint Christopher, explaining goodness and self-sacrifice.
Deflects Solara's compliment by expressing sadness and self-reproach for his violent past.
Stops Solara from taking the Bible by grabbing her wrist and questions her.
Shows caution and vigilance by sleeping lightly and guarding his belongings.
Keeps the Bible carefully wrapped and hidden in layers of clothing and a backpack, showing careful preservation of an important item.
Sleeps next to his pack in a cave, remaining alert enough to immediately respond when Solara tries to take the Bible, indicating vigilance and situational awareness.
Quickly grabs Solara’s wrist when she reaches for the Bible, demonstrating quick reflexes and protective instincts.
Refuses to simply hand over the book and questions Solara's intentions, showing prudent caution and confidence in guarding the Bible.
Gives a vague response about why he declines to read more from the book, potentially missing an opportunity to teach or bond, which could be seen as a slight social shortfall.
Forcefully tells Solara she cannot touch the book, grips her wrist tightly causing her pain.
Releases Solara's wrist after causing pain and lies back down with the book close to him.
Tells Solara maybe he can teach her to read the book when they have time.
Forcefully insists Solara not touch the book and physically enforces his rule by gripping her wrist to maintain control over the book.
Recognizes that Solara cannot read the book, demonstrating self-awareness and realistic assessment of others' capabilities.
Calmly takes control of the pack from Solara and secures it, showing protective and cautious behavior over valuable possessions.
Scolds Solara sharply for speaking irreverently about God, causing her surprise.
Explains his faith calmly and patiently when questioned about his path and guidance.
Demonstrates unwavering confidence and decisiveness in his direction and purpose, asserting his path is laid out by God and refusing to second-guess his journey.
Reacts severely and somewhat rigidly to Solara's questioning, showing a lack of openness to doubt or alternative perspectives.
Explains a difficult concept patiently to Solara despite her confusion.
Tells Solara to stay behind him as he approaches a potentially dangerous place, showing protective behavior.
Uses bolt-cutters to quietly and efficiently remove a padlock to gain entry.
Cautiously approaches a potentially dangerous area with shotgun ready, instructing Solara to stay behind him.
Admits 'I don't know' when questioned about how the intact house survived, showing honesty but lack of information.
Attempts to explain an abstract spiritual concept but fails to communicate it clearly to Solara.
Introduces himself and Solara politely, stating they mean no harm.
Apologizes for breaking into the house, explaining their misunderstanding.
Compliments the elderly man on his yard work sincerely.
Offers to leave respectfully if allowed.
Fails to notice a trap and is caught in a noose, dropping his shotgun.
Calmly introduces himself, tries to defuse tension with the elderly couple by explaining their intentions honestly and respectfully.
Politely compliments the elderly man’s work on his property to ease hostility.
Quickly offers to leave and not cause trouble when confronted.
Accepts help from Martha and allows himself to be helped to his feet after being trapped.
Exchanges a look with Solara, showing wariness and self-consciousness but does not express hostility or aggression towards the elderly couple.
Sits quietly and cooperatively in the elderly couple's home, accepting their offering of murky water without complaint.
Engages politely in conversation, asks Martha about her life.
Expresses confusion about how Martha and George survived, showing interest and perhaps empathy.
Asks thoughtful questions about survival and the home, showing awareness and curiosity.
Seems somewhat hesitant or unsure when tasting the tea ('It's.. uh...').
Warns Solara about the danger of cannibalism and the resulting disease, showing concern for her safety.
Politely declines hospitality (sandwiches and staying longer) despite tension in the situation.
Maintains a firm demeanor confronting George but does not escalate conflict.
Recognizes danger based on subtle signs (shaking hands), links it to known disease symptoms, and decides to leave quickly and confidently despite social pressure to stay.
Stares down George to maintain control of the situation and ensure safe exit.
Confirms Solara's recognition of approaching threat and immediately acts to protect her by bundling her back inside the house.
Recognizes the threat quickly and orders Solara back inside for safety.
Questions Solara to confirm the identity of the approaching armed vehicles before acting.
Readies his weapon silently and calmly, showing composure under threat.
Responds to the threat by thinking carefully before acting and asks Solara to hand him his pack, demonstrating protective leadership and care.
Reloads his shotgun and checks the barrel with practiced, expert skill without needing to be asked.
Thinks quietly under pressure when surrounded and being threatened by armed men.
Installs and throws a miniature claymore mine disguised as a bible into enemy territory, which successfully destroys vehicles and kills enemies, initiating an effective ambush.
Engages in a gunfight from cover efficiently alongside others, showing tactical awareness during chaotic combat.
Comforts Solara by reassuring her amidst chaos and gunfire.
Uses faith as encouragement to maintain hope for survival.
Dismisses George by saying 'He didn't mention you' when asked about others' safety.
Calmly reassures Solara under intense gunfire, keeps faith and shows confidence.
Uses precision marksmanship effectively to neutralize an enemy.
Stays composed and strategically covers during the firefight despite heavy risk.
Overlooks George's safety by not addressing him in his plans (negative implication in teamwork).
He looks for Solara after the crash and shows concern by asking if she is all right, embraces her.
Recognizes the danger of the oncoming van and dives clear, avoiding injury.
Despite a serious, bleeding wound, covers it, stands, and moves with purpose through smoke to find Solara.
Tries to assess Solara's condition immediately after the crash despite his own injury.
Helps Solara to her feet and encourages her to run to safety.
Remains calm and unflappable under threat of violence.
Uses his rat to bite Redridge, causing him pain during a search.
Shows sadness when Redridge stomps on the rat Eli used to defend himself
Keeps calm and does not retaliate when threatened at gunpoint by Redridge
Insists the book is worth giving up life for despite Solara's plea
Uses a rat to inflict pain and distract an opponent, demonstrating resourcefulness and tactical thinking.
Lowers his head in sadness after the rat is stomped, showing emotional vulnerability but not affecting his overall capability.
Remains calm and confident even when having a gun pressed to his forehead.
Stands firm in his belief that the book is worth risking his life for despite threats and danger.
Tells Solara 'I told you we'd both live. Now do you have faith?'
Walks away without retaliating when confronted and disarmed by Redridge.
Does not stop or turn to acknowledge Solara calling him, keeps walking steadily westward.
Keeps walking steadily and confidently without looking back despite being called out and chased, showing focus and discipline.
Forgives Solara after she admits to betraying him, showing compassion and understanding.
Appreciates Solara returning his sword, expressing gratitude.
Hides his pain to avoid worrying Solara, demonstrating consideration for her feelings.
Forgives Solara for betraying him, shows calm and composed emotional control.
Accepts the sword offered back to him with appreciation, showing practical awareness and readiness.
States he will keep heading west despite no longer having the book, demonstrating purpose and confidence rooted in faith.
Guesses why grass grows in this area, showing observational skills and logical reasoning.
Hides his pain from Solara, attempting to protect her or maintain composure despite physical distress.
Detects proximity to the ocean by smelling salt in the air, demonstrating situational awareness and sensory skill.
Leads Solara carefully across unstable terrain, using his sheathed sword to probe for loose rubble and advising her to step where he steps, showing caution, foresight, and leadership.
Continues moving confidently despite clutching his side in pain, indicating mental resilience and determination rather than incompetence.
Stops to take in the view at a high point looking over the area, possibly to assess the environment before proceeding, showing patience and strategic thinking.
Allows Solara to help him by taking his arm when he is weak and struggling with blood loss.
Shares his vision or goal ('the promised land') with Solara, inviting her to see what he sees.
Continuing to navigate through the dangerous post-apocalyptic environment despite severe blood loss and labored breathing, accepting help from Solara but still pressing onward.
Identifies and points out the destination (Alcatraz Island) as the 'promised land' after carefully assessing the environment.
Raises hands calmly when confronted with armed guards and communicates respectfully with them.
Does not show aggression or hostility despite being in a potentially dangerous situation.
Mentions possession of a King James Bible as a message, showing trust in dialogue and intention.
Calmly identifies himself and mentions possession of the King James Bible, attempting to negotiate entry rather than using force or panic.
Follows instructions carefully, stepping gingerly inside after gates open despite the potential threat of armed guards.
Shakes Professor Lombardi’s hand vigorously when introduced.
Responds politely and straightforwardly to Lombardi’s questions about the Bible.
Allows Solara to interact and speak during the introduction without interrupting.
Does not display overt friendliness beyond polite formalities in this scene.
Sincerely states he was sent by God to deliver the book.
Does not engage in small talk or warmth with Lombardi or Solara, gives brief responses.
States confidently that he was sent here by God, showing clarity and assurance in his purpose.
Admits the King James Bible he carries is 'a little beat-up' but asserts it will do the job, indicating realistic self-assessment and confidence in the usability of his resource.
Winces in pain and puts his hand to his side, signaling vulnerability or physical limitation, which may limit his competence in that moment.
Politely asks if there is someplace to sit despite being in pain.
Asks Lombardi and guards to bring plenty of writing paper to help with his task.
Requests Lombardi to write down every word exactly as he says.
Requests writing materials and directs others to get a large amount, demonstrating planning and foresight.
Instructs Lombardi clearly to write every word exactly as he says, showing command and precision.
Reads the Bible aloud patiently and precisely despite being blind.
Gives his Braille Bible to Carnegie and Claudia to help them read it.
Covers Solara with his coat to keep her warm as she sleeps while he continues reciting despite his pain.
Expresses gratitude and maintains faith despite his weakness and pain.
Expresses gratitude for the good he has done and hopes to have shone light into the darkness of the world.
Is remembered as a 'faithful servant to the Lord and friend to Solara' on his tombstone.
Expresses gratitude for the friend he made, prays for her safety, and reflects on fulfilling his mission with peace.
